page.title: 06FARMING IN DENHOLME
page.content:
Much land has been reclaimed from the rough moorland. Some of these {mixed {hill farms}go back 250 years. Various hardy breeds of sheep are kept. A variety of cattle are kept mainly for beef. One farm has 25,000 hens, others keep a few hens and pigs. Most farms are run by the family.
{Stockhouse Farm} sells frozen food, stocked by their own lambs and bulk purchased meat and vegetables. {Broadstones Farm} use some land to grow vegetables to sell in their shop. {Booth House Farm} is a small hill farm of 16 acres situated under Denholme Edge. School children from Bradford may visit this farm and can feed and handle the pure bred stock and learn about traditional farming methods.
